lesson.title: Example Lesson For All Activities
lesson.description: A lesson containing example versions of all activity types available at the moment.

activities.title: DnD Match Test
activities.instructions: Match items from the <source> to the correct (category/description/definition)
activities._comment: This is a test activity for the DnD Match type.
content: Typically offers associate level programs for 2 years of study.

activities.title: Test version
activities.instructions: Use the slider to indicate how much you agree with the following statements.

content.statement: I know what type of college I want to attend.
I know what type of degree I want to pursue.
I amconfident in my ability to apply for college.
I am likely to apply for financial aid for college.

activities.title: Example TextContent
activities.content:
TextContents can contain any markdown (https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/) formatting, including **bold**, _italic_, and [links](https://forwardinc.org). You can also include images like this:

![Example Image](example_image.png)

And you can include lists:

- Item 1
- Item 2
- Item 3

Or numbered lists:

1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item. 

 Headers are also supported:

# Header 1
## Header 2
### Header 3
#### Header 4
##### Header 5
###### Header 6. 

New lines are specified by two `\n\n` at the end of a line.  

You can also include blockquotes:

> This is a blockquote.

And code blocks:

```
function example() {
  console.log("This is an example code block.");
}
```

activities.title: Example Concept Map
activities.content: TConcept maps are a way of visually organizing information. They can help you see how different ideas are connected to each other. Below is an example of a concept map about types of colleges.

examples.title: Trade/Technical school
examples.description: Trade and technical schools, sometimes called vocational training schools, are schools that provide education for a specific focus area without requiring general education classes. These schools typically provide certificates or associates degrees, take 1-3 years to complete, and often incorporate lots of hands-on experience.

examples.name: Paul Mitchell
examples.description: A beauty school with multiple locations nationwide. Focus areas include cosmetology, barbering, esthetics, nails, and makeup.

examples.name: EVIT (East Valley Institute of Technology)
examples.description: Located in Arizona offers career training programs in health services (Examples: nursing and massage therapy), industrial trades (Examples: plumbing and welding), and service industries (aesthetics and cosmetology).

examples.name: Avalon Institute
examples.description: A beauty school focused on esthetics with locations in Arizona, Nevada, Utah and Colorado.

examples.name: NCTA (Nebraska College of Technical Agriculture)
examples.description: Located in Nebraska offers career training in a variety of agriculture and veterinary technology programs.

examples.name: Margaret H Rollins School of Nursing at Beebe Healthcare
examples.description: A nursing school located in Delaware and incorporated with Beebe Healthcare to provide clinical experiences.

examples.name: CAMTECH School of Construction
examples.description: Located in Florida, offers career specific training in construction to prepare students to be contractors.

examples.title: Community college
examples.description: Community colleges provide education for a variety of subjects, including general education and more career-specific classes. Most community colleges offer 2-year associates degrees and certificates. Some community colleges have begun offering 4-year bachelor’s degrees as well. Community colleges typically have lower <def def='a sum of money charged for teaching or instruction by a school, college, or university.'>tuition</def> than 4-year colleges and universities and may be more flexible in the times of day in which classes are offered.

examples.name: Johnson County Community College
examples.description: A community college in Kansas offering 45 different program areas

examples.name: College of Southern Idaho
examples.description: Home of the Eagles, a community college located in Idaho with more than 60 program areas

examples.name: Walla Walla Community College
examples.description: A community college located in Washington state that offers primarily associate’s degrees through two different campus locations and online.

examples.name: Santa Monica Community College
examples.description: Located in California, this college is close to the beach and has more than 50 subject areas.

examples.name: Lake Michigan College
examples.description: Home of the Red Hawks, a community college with more than 50 associate degree programs located in Michigan across several campuses.

examples.title: 4-year college
examples.description: 4-year colleges focus on offering bachelor’s degrees and provide classes in both general studies and specific focus areas, referred to as <def def='A college major is the specific academic subject area you choose to specialize in and focus most of your studies on to earn your degree.'>majors</def>. 4-year can include universities and liberal arts colleges, and are usually private (funded by tuition and other sources, sometimes more expensive or exclusive).

examples.name: Lewis & Clark College
examples.description: A private 4-year liberal arts college located in Oregon, offering around 30 different majors to about 2,000 <def def="An undergraduate is a college student who is working toward earning their first university degree, typically a bachelor's degree.">undergraduate</def> students. Lewis & Clark offers intercollegiate sports and programs that allow students to learn outside the classroom.

examples.name: Amherst College
examples.description: A private 4-year liberal arts college located in Massachusetts, has around 2,000 students with about 50% being students of color. Amherst offers about 40 different majors in arts, sciences, social sciences, and humanities.

examples.name: Brigham Young University of Idaho
examples.description: A larger private 4-year college located in Idaho with about 20,000 students and more than 100 different majors. BYU-Idaho is a religious university open to students of all backgrounds.

examples.name: Rhodes College
examples.description: A private 4-year college located in Tennessee offering more than 70 majors, minors, and interdisciplinary programs. Rhodes has strong extracurricular offerings for students including intercollegiate sports and Greek life.

examples.name: Knox College
examples.description: a private 4-year liberal arts college in Illinois with more than 60 majors and around 1,000 students. Knox emphasizes hands-on learning experience through internships and involvement in research.

examples.name: Truman State University
examples.description: A public 4-year college with about 3,500 students located in Missouri. Truman State offers 55 undergraduate programs and competitive athletics.

examples.title: University
examples.description: Universities are larger schools and offer a wide variety of majors and degrees, including certificates, associate’s bachelors, master’s, and doctoral degrees. They may also include professional training such as medical and law schools. Universities can be public (funded by the government, typically cheaper) or private (funded by tuition and other sources, sometimes more expensive or exclusive).

examples.name: Arizona State University (ASU)
examples.description: a public university in Arizona with high research activity. ASU is one of the largest public universities and has more than 60,000 undergraduate students.

examples.name: University of South Carolina (USC)
examples.description: A public university in South Carolina with about 45,000 undergraduate students and more than 100 majors. USC is considered a university with high research activity.

examples.name: Florida State University (FSU)
examples.description: A high research public university in Florida with about 30,000 undergraduate students. Florida State is well known for competitive athletics, especially football and baseball.

examples.name: Ohio State University (OSU)
examples.description: A public university in Ohio with high research activity and highly competitive athletic teams. OSU is one of the largest universities by enrollment and has around 50,000 undergraduate students.

examples.name: University of California-Los Angeles (UCLA)
examples.description: A public university in California with high research activity. UCLA has more than 140 majors and has around 30,000 undergraduate students enrolled.

activities.title: Example Identification
activities.instructions: Identifications are activities where you need to find specific information in a text.
activities.content:
:::center
 # In the documentation
:::

## I explain how to use the custom

::::columns
:::col
centering and
:::
:::col
columning notation
:::
::::

### for specific formatting
 use the <correct></correct> tags around a section that will count to the correct answers.

activities.title: Example Quiz
activities.instructions: This quiz will test your knowledge about college degrees. There is only one correct answer per question.

ranges.feedback: You might want to review the information about different degrees.
Great job! You understand the basics of higher education degrees.

questions.question_text: Which degree may require the GRE or GMAT test before applying?
Which degree has the highest median salary?
Which degree focuses on general subjects AND an in-depth study in a chosen field?
Which degree type do you need to become a dentist?
Which degree type are “MS” and “MEd” examples of?

activities.title: Example Video Activity
activities.instructions: Allows students to watch a video as part of the lesson. Set scrubbable to true to allow students to skip ahead in the video.
